reviews.sentence: Excellent customer service. We arrived with hopes off an early check in. There was a long line at the front desk. The concierge Mary approached us and brought us over to her desk. They were unable to check us in early as the rooms were not ready. So instead she checked our bags arranged a lunch reservation at a fabulous restaurant and tickets to see Independence Hall. When we returned to check in our room was ready and had an incredible view of the parkway and art museum. There was some fruit and cheese as well as a note from Mary thanking us for being patient with the hotel. Patient. We were only hoping to check in not expecting. They exceeded our expectations and we appreciated every member of staff we encountered during our stay.

Tired Hotel Needs help. This was a great disappointment. It did not meet my expectations. I was moved 3 times. Fortunately the staff came to my distress and the manger moved me finally to an acceptable room.
LocationHotel need to be updated its kinda ubsurd. Staff is awesome location is great. The building is huge and gorgeous it needs money and work though.
Great stay. Everything great staff no complaints it was my son birthday weekend they sent up 2 slices of cake and 2 glasses of milk and a handwritten note from the staff. That I had to leave.

Two stars is quite generous for this hotel. We were in Philadelphia for a conference. I had my mother 1 year old child and small dog with me. Upon arrival at 1030pm on a Wednesday there was no valet. I checked in with a woman who I do not think smiled the entire time. I told her I had a dog which was noted in my reservation. At that point it would have been helpful for her to tell me where I could take my dog to relieve herself. No. She maybe said 6 words the entire time. I wandered around in the dark to find a patch of grass for her. The bellman was very helpful and took our luggage to the room. I was then expected to park the car in the garage by myself which was dark and had no other people in it. It also had a fire alarm going off for at least 20 minutes while I was in there which means if you scream no one can hear you. We were on the 7th floor. It was dark and smelly. There were stains on the carpet in the hall. The room stunk of stale smoke to the point I did not want my child in there. The comforters had some yellow stains on them. The window sills were constantly wet with moisture. I did request a refrigerator and they delivered it right away and the gentleman that brought it was friendly. The two stars are mostly for the housekeeper. She was extremely nice checking on my mom and child frequently. She deserves 5 stars herself but the hotel itself I can only give 2.
Nice place very nice service.

2nd time around would stay here again. The hotel shows signs of ware but it is in a great location and the rooms are comfortable and clean. Staff very friendly and accommodating. I recommend the economy self park across the street.
Pleasant. All meals were pretty good. The wait staff was very attentive. There was a cockroach in the lobby bathroom.

The parking lot staff were very helpful. They did not have the king room that we booked and did not seem to care. The Hotel looked very dated. The room was small and carpet walls warped. Overall very disappointed. Elevators were not working.

When in town I will stay there ask others too also. Pillows love them. Easy access room service. Met. Monique would have liked to see her again. Maybe next time I am there she can see me. Kinda pricey for breakfast. did not see anything special. Like Belgium waffles. Or. Eggs Benedict. Overall I enjoyed myself. Next time I plan to see phily I will book again Thank you. The price of breakfast. Too pricey.

The best thing about this hotel is their concierge Mary Mastrobuoni. We were just there for the NEQ volleyball tournament. We flew in from CO and to our surprise this was the worst hotel experience our team has ever had1. Computers were down and waited 3 hours in lobby upon arival2. Once obtained key card malfunctioned and got locked out3. No wifi service in rooms unles you paid additional 150 day4. No refrigerators in room. For travelling teams like ours its ridiculous that we ca n’t get our own snack and food supplies that must be kept cold5. No microwave6. Teams that arrived on Friday night stood in line for 15 hr to check in7. We were told on Sunday night that the dryers were out of service and they had run out of toilet paperI have stayed in hotels all over the country and indeed in most foreign countries … never have I had such a bad experience as this past weekend. In time I will forget the disaster of this 4 night stay but I will never forget the helfulnes of the concierge lady. Mary M She is a gem. On Easter Sunday our team wanted to go up the observation deck but after several calls and no one answering we almost gave up. I asked Mary to help and boy did she. She walked over there herself and got us a discounted group rate. Give that woman a raise.

I was given a really bad room first floor at the very end of the hall. Every morning I had to struggle at breakfast time because my room number was not included in the breakfast included list I did have breakfast included. Very poor service at the front desk always a line. The concierge offered to email me the bill and to this point I have not received it.

The hotel was the worst I have ever had to stay in. The website never mentioned there was construction when I booked it I am which every morning at 8 they decided to start drilling and working even on Sunday. The hotel staff said well that is your fault you booked from a third party site and did not care when I complained. When I booked through your site it said parking included but yet they charged me 50 for parking. There were so many people complaining to the hotel staff and not one of them cared what anyone had to say. I will never book this hotel again and just so everyone knows when you book from Expedia you get false information on what you will actually get. The rooms were horrible carpets looked like they were not cleaned in months room smelled like mildew and all morning and day you hear nothing but construction going on and since you go through Expedia the staff does not care.
They hired new front desk staff and now it is 100 better there. Customer Service wise.

Nice location Unfriendly Front Desk Agents. Arrived in Philadelphia a bit early and inquired with a front desk agent about the possibility of an early check in even if we had to pay. This unsmiling and totally unfriendly agent named Ashley proceeded to tell me that C. I is not until 3 pm and when I informed her that I used to work at Westin and I know the drill of running a hotel and we are willing to pay for early C I she said that they do not have rooms. Fair enough sometimes those thing happen. I did a pre reg a hotel verbiage meaning doing everything the hotel needs and just waiting for key to a clean room and give her my cell phone number to call if a room gets cleaned. Make things short at 3 pm we came back to hotel and was given a room but my complain is no one even informed us that there were rooms cleaned and ready and I am sure this was not the 1st room cleaned. In the hotel I worked at we take responsibility to fulfill guest requests. Also the hotel really needs renovations big time cracked marble in bathroom frayed carpets in hallway and room etc and their staffs need to be retrained in hospitality business such as making eye contact with guests acknowledging guests in front of you even if you can not help at that moment friendliness smiling under promise but over deliver. Sometimes I stay by the lobby and I noticed that agents at front desk are stoic and rarely smile. Door people are friendly though. Come on Sheraton corporate executive this hotel is in nice location make it shine.

The staff was comprised of complete idiots with negative attitudes. Any question or interaction with each of them was met with an attitude like no other. I had two rooms during my stay both were grotesque smells in the pillows that made all of my guests and I have reactions in our eyes. the smallest bathrooms you could barely wash your hands without hitting into the shower toilet just an overall disappointment.

Amazing in every way. I first read some pretty difficult reviews but got a great deal on price and went anyway because of the looks of the website. Absolutely amazing decisionOur room was very clean and had everything we needed. We had a line to check in and they even had concierge handing out free water cookies and chips to everyone while we waited. The food was not overly expensive and very good. The waiter was very informative and helpful. We wanted to find a little restaurant nearby by recommendation and the concierge the next day drew us a map to a local favorite and it did not disappoint. I recommend This hotel to anyone it ’s close to everything and I felt quite at home and very welcome here. I will definitely stay here again. Thanks for making my experience in Phily a great one.

Going downhill. We have stayed here a few times a year for more than five years. Used to be a decent hotel. Since Sheraton sold it it ’s gotten worse. For this visit our room was n’t available at 245 and we never received a text or call when it was ready as promised. When we showed up at 40 staff tried to give us a queen room when we reserved a king gave us a room on a different floor than requested on the wrong side of hotel as requested then gave us an argument when we stated we had requested a late checkout which we had had every other time we ’ve been here for the last five years. The members ’ lounge is gone used to be on 24th floor with snacks and drinks and replaced with more rooms. When we got to the room there was no luggage rack so we had no place to put the suitcase. Lamps are so old that they had no outlets or USB ports for phones. Parking has changed to valet only for 50 a day. Despite the convenient location we ’re searching for a different place to stay later this year. I doubt that we ’l be back.

I can not speak on the hotel itself but the customer service is appalling. I needed to make changes to a room block on Tuesday and no one at the front desk answered I called 4 times. Finally someone on Wednesday morning answered and directed me to someone in sales so I left someone a message there. Come Thursday afternoon I still had not heard anything so I called again. finally got that person to answer and they asked if I can email them my requests so I did immediately. On Friday morning today I emailed back just to confirm my email had been received and you guessed it no response. So I call sales again and leave a message around 11 am. it is now 5 pm and I still have heard from NO ONE. I have called sales twice since then and my call has gone to voicemail and I have called the front desk twice for no one to answer not even voicemail. I am now having to use TWITTER to hopefully get in touch with management to get this fixed today. My colleagues come in on Monday. I work with hotels daily and have never seen such a lack of customer service. Ridiculous and unacceptable are not strong enough words to describe this experience in trying to change 4 reservations on a group of 14.

Zero stars Mariot needs to renovate its rooms and retrain the front desk staff. 1. I was locked in my hotel room and late to a meeting because the deadbolt could not be disengaged inside my room. The front desk line was busy but eventually I got through and they sent a building engineer to open the door from the outside. 2. There was a fire alarm at 1210 AM and my floor was told not to evacuate. 3. I was also woken by a construction crew banging around at 7 AM one morning. Each time I called the front desk to complain the clerks were brusque did not apologize and questioned my statements. My colleagues were offered free breakfast and drinks when they complained or waited 3 hours for check in I received nothing but raised voices. 4. The bedroom carpets are dirty and bumpy. 5. The entertainment unit in my room has pieces of wood stuffed under the corners and has exposed pieces of particle board. 6. There is no laundry room for guests. I am amazed that anyone would choose to stay here.
